messages.text:
This will replace blogger for blog.golang.org.

Test instance at: http://blog-test.golang.org/

Content follows in a separate CL: http://codereview.appspot.com/7436052

https://codereview.appspot.com/7382064/diff/31001/static/play/play.js
File static/play/play.js (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/7382064/diff/31001/static/play/play.js#newcode1
static/play/play.js:1: // Copyright 2012 The Go Authors. All rights reserved.
Copied from go.talks, does not need to be reviewed.

https://codereview.appspot.com/7382064/diff/31001/static/play/playground.js
File static/play/playground.js (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/7382064/diff/31001/static/play/playground.js#newcode1
static/play/playground.js:1: // Copyright 2012 The Go Authors. All rights reserved.
Copied from go.talks, does not need to be reviewed.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.blog

It'd be nice if the blog could get a splash of colour (it's very
plain; even plainer than golang.org), or at least some shading to
separate the nav bar on the right from the content.

LGTM

code seems fine. i agree it's a bit drab, but we can check this in and work on the design.

would it go live once checked in?

On 8 March 2013 04:27, <r@golang.org> wrote:

> code seems fine. i agree it's a bit drab, but we can check this in and
> work on the design.
>

SGTM

would it go live once checked in?
>

Nope, the switch over will be done manually.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=63dd96b078ce&repo=blog ***

go.blog: blog server

R=golang-dev, dsymonds, r
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/7382064
